info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 3:30PM CDT until March 31 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM CDT FOR WESTERN BOWIE...NORTHERN MORRIS...NORTHEASTERN TITUS AND SOUTHEASTERN RED RIVER COUNTIES... At 329 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Wilkerson, or 9 miles south of Boxelder, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Boxelder, De Kalb, Dalby Springs, Us 259 And I 30 Intersection, Wilkerson, Avery, Almont, Spring Hill, Harts Bluff and Lydia. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northeastern Texas. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
